eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Punjab.
The applicant should be a person with a disability.
The percentage of the disability should be 80% or more.
The applicant’s age should be between 18 and 80 years.
benefits: Pension is Rs. 300/- per month (age 18-79 year)
Pension is Rs. 500/- per month (age 80 and above year)
required_documents: Identity Proof (Voter ID Card/ Driving License)

additional_details.meta_description: The "Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS)" provides ₹300/- per month to disabled persons (80% or more disability) aged 18 and above. After age 80, the amount increases to ₹500/-. Dwarfs are also eligible.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: The "Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS)" is implemented by the Department of Social Security and Development of Women and Children, Government of Punjab. Under this scheme, persons with disabilities aged 18 years and above, having a disability level of 80% or more, are eligible to receive a pension of ₹300/- per month. After attaining the age of 80 years, the pension amount increases to ₹500/- per month. Dwarfs are also included as an eligible category under this scheme.
Benefits: Pension is Rs. 300/- per month (age 18-79 year)Pension is Rs. 500/- per month (age 80 and above year)
Pension is Rs. 300/- per month (age 18-79 year)
Pension is Rs. 500/- per month (age 80 and above year)
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Punjab.The applicant should be a person with a disability.The percentage of the disability should be 80% or more.The applicant’s age should be between 18 and 80 years.
The applicant should be a resident of Punjab.
The applicant should be a person with a disability.
The percentage of the disability should be 80% or more.
The applicant’s age should be between 18 and 80 years.
Application Process: OfflineOnlineStep 1:The interested applicant should visit the District Social Security Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned staff.Step 2:In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 3:Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to theDistrict Social Security Officer.Step 4:Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
Documents Required: Identity Proof (Voter ID Card/ Driving License)Disability CertificateProof of AgeAddress ProofBank Account Details
Identity Proof (Voter ID Card/ Driving License)
Frequently Asked Questions: What are the eligibility criteria related to age for receiving the monthly pension under this scheme?Applicants must be between 18 and 80 years of age. Those aged 80 and above receive a higher pension amount.Is there a specific disability percentage required to qualify for the pension scheme?Yes, the applicant must have a disability level of 80% or more to be eligible.Do individuals with dwarfism qualify for this pension scheme?Yes, dwarfs are included as an eligible category under this scheme.What is the monthly pension amount for beneficiaries aged between 18 and 79 years?Eligible beneficiaries receive ₹300 per month if they are between 18 and 79 years of age.Does the pension amount increase after a certain age, and if so, by how much?Yes, after turning 80, the pension increases from ₹300 to ₹500 per month.Is there a residency requirement to apply for this pension scheme?Yes, only residents of Punjab are eligible to apply for this pension.What type of identity proof is accepted when applying for the pension?Accepted identity proof includes a Voter ID Card or Driving License.Is a disability certificate mandatory for the application process?Yes, a valid disability certificate must be submitted as proof of disability.What documents are required as proof of age for the application?Applicants must provide an official document verifying their age, such as a birth certificate or Aadhaar card.What address proof documents are acceptable for submission with the application?Any valid government-issued document confirming the applicant’s residential address in Punjab is acceptable.Are bank account details required to receive the pension benefits?Yes, a bank passbook or account details must be provided for pension disbursement.Where can an applicant obtain the offline application form for this scheme?The form can be collected from the District Social Security Officer’s office.What should an applicant do after filling out the offline application form?They must attach self-attested copies of required documents and submit the form to the District Social Security Officer.How can an applicant apply online for this pension scheme?They must register on the UMANG portal and complete the application under the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP).

Details: The scheme "Bhajan Pakhawaj Workshops" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to provide knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing to Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field. Applications are invited by announcement in local print and electronic media. Certificates are awarded to the participants. A Suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops.
Benefits: Knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing is provided to the Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field.Certificates are awarded to the participants.A suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops.*The venue of the workshop is decided by Kala Academy.
Knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing is provided to the Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field.
Certificates are awarded to the participants.
A suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops.
Eligibility: For Trainee:The applicant should be a Bhajan performer.For Workshop Conductor:The applicant should be an expert in traditional Bhajan Singing or Pakhawaj playing.
Application Process: OfflineStep 1:The applications for this scheme are invited by announcement in local print and electronic media.Step 2:In the provided application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the supporting documents.Step 3:Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to theMember Secretary, Kala Academy, Goa.Authority for Redressal of Grievances:Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa.
Documents Required: For Trainee:Documents supporting that the applicant is a Bhajan performer.For Workshop Conductor:Documents supporting that the applicant is an expert in traditional Bhajan Singing or Pakhawaj playing.
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the main objective of the workshops focused on Bhajan singing and Pakhawaj playing?The workshops aim to provide knowledge of traditional Bhajan singing and Pakhawaj playing to performers, guided by experts in these fields.How are applicants informed about the opportunity to participate in these workshops?Applications are invited through announcements in local print and electronic media.Will participants receive any certification after completing the workshop sessions?Yes, certificates are awarded to all participants who attend the workshops.Is there any financial compensation provided to the experts conducting these workshops?Yes, a suitable honorarium is paid to the conductors of the workshops.Which authority should interested individuals contact for suggestions regarding the workshops?Suggestions can be sent to the Member Secretary of Kala Academy Goa.If an applicant faces any issues or grievances, who should they approach for resolution?Grievances can be addressed to either the Member Secretary or the Chairman of Kala Academy Goa.Are these workshops open to all performers interested in Bhajan singing and Pakhawaj playing?Yes, applications are invited from Bhajan performers interested in learning these traditional art forms.What kind of training can participants expect from these workshops?The training focuses on traditional Bhajan singing and Pakhawaj playing under expert guidance.Can applicants suggest workshop topics or areas of focus?Yes, suggestions can be submitted to the Member Secretary of Kala Academy Goa.How can applicants stay updated about future workshop announcements?They should monitor local print and electronic media for official announcements.

knowledge_base_entry.scheme: Laado Protsahan Yojana
knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a woman who is a native of Rajasthan.
The applicant should deliver the girl child in a government medical institution or a private medical institution authorized under the Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY).
The applicant should ensure full immunization of the child (for second installment).
The applicant's child should be enrolled in a recognized school or institution for subsequent installments.
The applicant’s daughter should graduate from a recognized higher education institution and attain the age of 21 to receive the final installment.
benefits: Total financial benefit of ₹1,50,000/- disbursed in 7 installments:
A commitment letter of ₹1.50 lakh will be issued at the birth of a girl child.
The entire amount will be disbursed online through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) in seven installments.

Until the girl attains adulthood, the first six installments will be transferred to the bank account of her parents or guardian, and the seventh installment will be transferred to the girl's own bank account through DBT.

If the benefit of any installment is not availed at any stage after the first two installments of the scheme, the eligible girl child may still be granted the next installment, provided a valid and reasonable justification is given.

There is no limit on the number of girl children eligible to receive the third and subsequent installments under the scheme. All girls who have already received the first two installments will be entitled to continue receiving benefits under the scheme.
The Rajshree Yojana will be merged with the Laado Protsahan Yojana, and the remaining installments of the Rajshree Yojana will be provided under the Laado Protsahan Yojana as per eligibility.
required_documents: Birth Certificate of the Girl Child
Institutional Delivery Proof from Government or JSY-Authorized Medical Facility
Age Proof Document (for verifying completion of 21 years of age)
Unique ID/PCTS ID issued at birth
application_steps: Data is entered on PCTS portal during antenatal checkups and post-institutional delivery.
DBT is done automatically by the Department of Medical, Health & Family Welfare.
Full immunization record must be uploaded on thePCTS/OJASportal.
Based on verification, payment is made to parent/guardian’s account.
Automatically tracked by schools through the portal using earlier installment IDs.
No fresh application is required from parents/guardians.
The Department of Higher Education uploads the girl’s graduation documents.
Payment is made to the girl’s own bank account after verifying she is 21 years old.

Details: The Scheme "Laado Protsahan Yojana" was launched on 1st August 2024 by the Department of Women Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan. The scheme aims to encourage the birth of girl children in poor families and promote their holistic development. Under this scheme, financial support is provided in seven installments to the parents or guardians of girls born in Government/authorized Medical Institutions.Objectives:Promote a positive mindset towards the birth of a girl child and ensure her holistic development.Eliminate gender discrimination in childcare, education, and health.Promote institutional deliveries and reduce maternal mortality.Reduce infant mortality among girls and improve the child sex ratio.Ensure enrollment and retention of girls in schools.Encourage higher education for girls and reduce child marriage.

Application Process: OfflineApplication process for the Applicant:Step 1:The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme.Step 2:The applicant should visit the nearest office of the Department of Medical, Health & Family Welfare.Application process for the Department of Medical, Health & Family WelfareFor First and Second Installments:Data is entered on PCTS portal during antenatal checkups and post-institutional delivery.DBT is done automatically by the Department of Medical, Health & Family Welfare.For Second Installment:Full immunization record must be uploaded on thePCTS/OJASportal.Based on verification, payment is made to parent/guardian’s account.For Installments 3 to 6 (School Admissions):Automatically tracked by schools through the portal using earlier installment IDs.No fresh application is required from parents/guardians.For Final (Seventh) Installment:The Department of Higher Education uploads the girl’s graduation documents.Payment is made to the girl’s own bank account after verifying she is 21 years old.

Frequently Asked Questions: Who can apply for the Laado Protsahan Yojana?Only permanent residents of Rajasthan who give birth to a girl child in government or JSY-authorized medical institutions.What is the total benefit amount under this scheme?A total of ₹1,50,000 is given in 7 installments.Is any application form required for the first installment?No. The benefit is processed automatically via the PCTS portal.Is the scheme available for girls born at home?No. Only institutional deliveries in authorized facilities are eligible.What if one installment is missed?The next eligible installment can be availed with a valid reason for the missed stage.Who receives the final installment?The girl herself, after graduating and turning 21.Which schools are valid for school-stage installments?Government schools or private schools recognized by the Rajasthan Government.Can private school students get the benefits?Yes, if the school is recognized by the Rajasthan Government.﻿﻿How is the scheme tracked?Through PCTS and OJAS portals using a Unique ID generated at birth.﻿What happens if the girl doesn’t pursue graduation?The final installment is not awarded unless she graduates and turns 21.Who supervises the scheme at the state level?Directorate of Women Empowerment, Women & Child Development Department.How frequently is the scheme reviewed?Every three months by the District Collector and BBBP Task Force.

eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant must be between 18 to 50 years of age.
The applicant must have an orthopedic disability of 40% or more, certified by a civil surgeon.
The applicant must possess a Disability Identity Card issued by the Social Security Department.
The applicant must be listed in the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category with a score of 0 to 20.
The applicant must not have already availed benefits under this scheme in the last five years, unless the previously allotted electric scooter is damaged and the applicant remains otherwise eligible.
The applicant must purchase the electric scooter from an agency approved by JEDA at the government-approved price.
benefits: Financial Assistance:Up to the limit of 50% of the basic cost of the electric scooter + 50% of the disability kit or ₹25,000/-.

additional_details.meta_description: The "Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person" provides financial assistance of up to ₹25,000 for the purchase of electric scooters to eligible persons with orthopedic disabilities.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: The "Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person" is a welfare scheme by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote mobility and independence for orthopedically disabled individuals in Gujarat by offering a financial subsidy. The beneficiary can purchase an electric scooter through an agency approved by JEDA. After verification, the financial assistance amounting to ₹25,000 (or 50% of the scooter and kit cost, whichever is lower) will be directly deposited into the beneficiary's bank account.
Benefits: Financial Assistance:Up to the limit of 50% of the basic cost of the electric scooter + 50% of the disability kit or ₹25,000/-.
Financial Assistance:Up to the limit of 50% of the basic cost of the electric scooter + 50% of the disability kit or ₹25,000/-.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant must be between 18 to 50 years of age.The applicant must have an orthopedic disability of 40% or more, certified by a civil surgeon.The applicant must possess a Disability Identity Card issued by the Social Security Department.The applicant must be listed in the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category with a score of 0 to 20.The applicant must not have already availed benefits under this scheme in the last five years, unless the previously allotted electric scooter is damaged and the applicant remains otherwise eligible.The applicant must purchase the electric scooter from an agency approved by JEDA at the government-approved price.Note:The applicant will be given priority if their name appears in the SECC-2011 (Socio-Economic Caste Census) data.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant must be between 18 to 50 years of age.
The applicant must have an orthopedic disability of 40% or more, certified by a civil surgeon.
The applicant must possess a Disability Identity Card issued by the Social Security Department.
The applicant must be listed in the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category with a score of 0 to 20.
The applicant must not have already availed benefits under this scheme in the last five years, unless the previously allotted electric scooter is damaged and the applicant remains otherwise eligible.
The applicant must purchase the electric scooter from an agency approved by JEDA at the government-approved price.

Frequently Asked Questions: What is the primary objective of the "Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person"?The primary objective of the Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person is to enhance the mobility, independence, and quality of life of orthopedic disabled individuals in Gujarat by offering financial assistance for the purchase of an electric scooter through a state-approved process.﻿﻿How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?Under this scheme, the Government of Gujarat provides financial assistance of up to ₹25,000 or 50 percent of the basic cost of the electric scooter and the disability modification kit, whichever is lower, directly into the beneficiary’s bank account.﻿﻿Who can apply for benefits under this scheme?Any orthopedic disabled person who is a resident of Gujarat, aged between 18 and 50 years, having a certified disability of 40% or more, and listed in the BPL category with a 0 to 20 score, is eligible to apply under this scheme, subject to the prescribed conditions.﻿﻿Are both men and women eligible for this scheme?Yes, both male and female applicants with orthopedic disabilities meeting all eligibility conditions are considered eligible for assistance under this scheme, without any gender-based exclusion.﻿﻿Is the scheme limited to individuals with specific types of disabilities?Yes, the scheme is exclusively applicable to individuals with orthopedic disabilities and does not cover those with other forms of disabilities.﻿﻿What kind of priority is given to applicants during selection?Priority in the selection process is given to applicants whose names appear in the SECC-2011 (Socio-Economic Caste Census-2011) list, especially those falling under the BPL category with a score ranging from 0 to 20.﻿﻿How does one obtain the application form for this scheme?The application form for this scheme is made available free of cost and may be obtained from the office of the District Social Security Officer and submitted when the government issues a public advertisement inviting applications.﻿﻿How are beneficiaries selected after submitting their application?After the verification of applications by the District Social Security Officer, beneficiaries are selected through a computerized draw to ensure transparency and fairness in the distribution process.﻿﻿From where the beneficiaries are required to purchase the electric scooter?Beneficiaries are required to purchase the electric scooter only from an agency designated by JEDA (Gujarat Energy Development Agency), at a price determined and approved at the state level.﻿﻿How is the assistance amount disbursed to the selected beneficiary?Once the beneficiary is selected and the purchase conditions are fulfilled, the assistance amount is deposited directly into the beneficiary’s registered bank account by the Director’s Office through the designated dealer.﻿﻿Can an individual apply again if the previously provided scooter gets damaged?If an individual has previously received a scooter under this scheme and the scooter has been damaged, the applicant can reapply after a minimum period of five years, provided they continue to meet the eligibility conditions.﻿﻿

Details: The "Live Fish Vending Center" Scheme was launched by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY). additional_details.meta_description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh, fostering national unity. Intended beneficiaries include native Gujaratis who complete the yatra and apply within 60 days.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: Launched in 2017, the scheme "Sindhu Darshan Scheme" by the Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh, promoting cultural unity. The scheme provides a one-time financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to eligible pilgrims and supports a maximum of 300 pilgrims per financial year. To be eligible, the applicant must be a native of Gujarat and must submit proof of completing the yatra within 60 days of its conclusion. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board. The applications are accepted offline via a prescribed form available on the official website.
Benefits: Financial Assistance:One-time grant of ₹15,000/- per pilgrim.Beneficiary Cap:Limited to 300 pilgrims per financial year.Disbursement Condition:Proof of yatra completion must be submitted within 60 days.Validity:Once in a lifetime per pilgrim.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a native of Gujarat.The applicant must have completed the Sindhu Darshan Yatra.The applicant must submit the application within 60 days of completing the yatra.The applicant must not have availed the benefit before under this scheme.
The applicant must be a native of Gujarat.
The applicant must have completed the Sindhu Darshan Yatra.
The applicant must submit the application within 60 days of completing the yatra.
The applicant must not have availed the benefit before under this scheme.
Application Process: OfflineStep 1:The interested applicant should take a printout of theprescribed formatof the application form.Step 2:In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields (details of the authorized travel agent/organizer, details of the pilgrims), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3:Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to"Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar"within 60 days of yatra completion.*Retain a copy of the submitted application for future reference.﻿Verification & DisbursementThe board processes applications, and financial assistance is credited to the beneficiary’s account.
Documents Required: Proof of Being a Native of GujaratAadhaar CardBank Details (Cancelled Cheque/Passbook Copy)Travel Proof (Bus/Railway/Air Ticket)Identity Card Issued by Sindhu Darshan Yatra Samiti, DelhiYatra Completion Certificate from Sindhu Darshan Yatra Samiti, DelhiElection Card/Driving LicenseRecent Photograph

Identity Card Issued by Sindhu Darshan Yatra Samiti, Delhi

Frequently Asked Questions: What is the purpose of this financial assistance scheme for pilgrims?The scheme aims to support pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh by providing a one-time grant of ₹15,000/- to promote cultural unity.Who is eligible to apply for this financial assistance?Applicants must be native residents of Gujarat and must have completed the Sindhu Darshan Yatra.Is there a deadline for submitting the application after completing the yatra?Yes, applicants must submit their application within 60 days of completing the yatra to be eligible.Can I apply for this financial assistance if I’ve already received it once before?No, the benefit is only available once in a lifetime per pilgrim.What is the maximum number of pilgrims who can receive this financial aid in a year?The scheme supports a maximum of 300 pilgrims per financial year, on a first-come, first-served basis.What documents are required to prove my eligibility as a native of Gujarat?You must submit documents such as an Aadhaar Card, Election Card, or Driving License as proof of residency.What kind of travel proof is needed to confirm my participation in the yatra?You must provide bus/railway/air tickets and a Yatra Completion Certificate issued by the Sindhu Darshan Yatra Samiti, Delhi.How and where should I submit my application for this scheme?Duly filled applications must be submitted offline to the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar, within 60 days of yatra completion.Is there a specific format for the application form, and where can I find it?Yes, the prescribed application form is available for download on the official website: https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in.How and when will the financial assistance be disbursed if my application is approved?After verification, the ₹15,000/- grant will be directly credited to the beneficiary’s bank account.

Details: The "Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles" scheme was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, The Tamil Nadu Folk Artiste's Welfare Board provides assistance of ₹500/- for the purchase of spectacles to registered folk artists. The assistance shall be restricted to two thousand registered folk artists per year on “First come – First serve” basis.
Benefits: Financial Assistance maximum of ₹500/-Note:This assistance shall be given only once.
Financial Assistance maximum of ₹500/-

Frequently Asked Questions: Who is eligible for assistance?Only registered folk artists are eligible for assistance.What is the maximum assistance amount?The maximum assistance amount is ₹500/-.How many folk artists can receive assistance per year?Assistance is limited to 2,000 registered folk artists per year.How many times can a folk artist avail this assistance?Each folk artist can avail of this assistance only once.What are the conditions for eligibility?Conditions include having no dues payable to the board and not availing similar benefits from other government schemes.What form should be used for the application?Form XIII should be used for the application.Where should the application be submitted?The application should be submitted to the designated regional assistant director.Who is the sanctioning authority?The sanctioning authority is the Secretary or any other authorized officer of the board.Who is the appellate authority?The appellate authority is A. Daniel Premnath, Secretary of the Tamilnadu Folk Artiste's Welfare Board.Can a folk artist with dues to the board apply?No, folk artists with dues payable to the board are not eligible.Can a folk artist who has availed similar benefits from another scheme apply?No, folk artists who have availed similar benefits from other government schemes are not eligible.What evidences need to be produced?Evidences required include a medical prescription from a registered eye specialist and the purchase bill.Is there any region-specific contact information for application submission?Region-specific contact information for application submission is provided for various regions in Tamilnadu.Is there a specific brand or type of spectacles covered?There are no specifications regarding the brand or type of spectacles covered.Is there an age limit for availing this assistance?There is no age limit specified for availing this assistance.

Details: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation (ABC) launched the “Bharati Scheme for Education - 1st Class to 5th Class" for the academic year to encourage Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh to continue their education.  Under this scheme, eligible poor Brahmin student applicants will receive financial assistance for the academic year. This scheme is applicable for the Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh covering all 13 districts.
Benefits: Financial Assistance for the 1stClass to 5thClass: ₹5,000/-.
Financial Assistance for the 1stClass to 5thClass: ₹5,000/-.
Eligibility: The student and his/her parents should belong to the Brahmin community.The student should be studying in Andhra Pradesh.The student's parents/guardians should reside in Andhra Pradesh.The annual family income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.The student under the category of orphan, differently abled (physically handicapped), or children of single parents' priority will be given.The student should be enrolled in the Praja Sadhikara Survey (PSS).The student should not have availed himself/ herself of any amount under any other government scheme for the same purpose.  However, students availing benefit from Archaka Welfare Trust are eligible under this scheme.
The student and his/her parents should belong to the Brahmin community.
The student should be studying in Andhra Pradesh.
The student's parents/guardians should reside in Andhra Pradesh.
The annual family income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.
The student under the category of orphan, differently abled (physically handicapped), or children of single parents' priority will be given.
The student should be enrolled in the Praja Sadhikara Survey (PSS).

The student should not have availed himself/ herself of any amount under any other government scheme for the same purpose.  However, students availing benefit from Archaka Welfare Trust are eligible under this scheme.
Application Process: OnlineRegistrationStep-01:Applicants have to visit theofficial websiteand click onScheme.Step-02:Click on "Registration" under the concerned scheme name.Step-03:Fill out the application form with required details like:Personal Details: Name, Residence address, Aadhaar no, Ration card no, Bank detail etcUpload: Photo, Signature and Certificate DetailsDocuments: Birth Certificate, Residential Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Caste Certificate, Bank Passbook etcFinalize and "Submit" the application.Step-04:Receive the reference number after the submission.﻿Check Application Status:Step-01:Click on the “Services” link on the menu and select "Know your status".Step-02:Enter the Reference or Mobile or Aadhaar Card Number to get the application status.Step-03:Select the "Financial Year" and Fetch the details.﻿Download the Acknowledgement slip:Step-01:Applicants have to visit theofficial websiteand click onScheme.Step-02:Click on the "Acknowledgement Slip" under the concerned scheme.Step-03:Enter the Aadhaar Card Number and select the "Scheme".Step-04:Click on the "Submit".
Personal Details: Name, Residence address, Aadhaar no, Ration card no, Bank detail etc
Upload: Photo, Signature and Certificate Details
Documents: Birth Certificate, Residential Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Caste Certificate, Bank Passbook etc
Finalize and "Submit" the application.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card of the Student & Parents (with address in Andhra Pradesh).White Ration Card / Income Certificate Number (issued by Mee Seva).Caste Certificate (issued by MeeSeva).Residence Certificate (issued by MeeSeva).Birth Certificate (issued by MeeSeva).Study Certificate from the School.SB Account Passbook in the name of the Applicant.NOTE:The account should be in Andhra Bank or SBI Bank).
Aadhaar Card of the Student & Parents (with address in Andhra Pradesh).

SB Account Passbook in the name of the Applicant.
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the Bharati Scheme for Education (BSE)?It is a scheme to provide financial assistance to poor Brahmin students in Andhra Pradesh for their education.Who is eligible for the BSE scheme?Brahmin students in Andhra Pradesh studying from 1st Standard to 5th Standard during the academic year.What is the maximum annual family income for eligibility?The annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.What is the primary aim of the BSE scheme?To encourage Brahmin students in Andhra Pradesh to continue their education.Can students who failed in any subjects apply?No, only students who have passed all subjects till the previous year of study are eligible.Is the scheme applicable to students receiving benefits from other government schemes?No, except for students availing benefits from the Archaka Welfare Trust.What is the financial assistance for students from 1st to 5th Class?The financial assistance for students from 1st to 5th Class ₹5,000/-.What is the last date to apply for the BSE scheme?The specific last date for application submission is not mentioned in the provided details.Where can students apply for the BSE scheme?Online through the Corporation’s portal (www.andhrabrahmin.ap.gov.in).Who will finalize the selection of applicants?The State Level Selection Committee (SLSC) of A.P. Brahmin Welfare Corporation.

knowledge_base_entry.scheme: Buffalo Entrepreneurship Development Scheme
knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a farmer, entrepreneur, or member of SHG.
The applicant belongs to General, SC, ST categories, SHG members, PWD, Women, and Transgender individuals.
The applicant should purchase two Graded Murrah She Buffaloes, preferably in their 1st or 2nd lactation and yielding a minimum of 8 liters of milk per day.
If the applicant is a PwD, their disability should be more than 40%.
An individual per family will be eligible to avail assistance only once.

additional_details.meta_description: The "Buffalo Entrepreneurship Development Scheme" aims to enhance livestock productivity, especially among marginalized farmers in Odisha. This scheme seeks to address protein deficiency, boost nutritional status, & promote livelihood through dairy farming.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...
table_1: After completion of the shed and purchase of 1st milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance 50% of the subsidy amount
After the purchase of 2nd milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance-50% of the subsidy amount
table_2: Purchase of 1 milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance for 3 years 50% of the subsidy amount
After the purchase of 2nd milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance for 3 years- 50% of the subsidy amount

Details: The "Buffalo Entrepreneurship Development Scheme" was launched by the Fisheries and Animal Resources Development Department, Government of Odisha. The scheme aims to enhance livestock productivity, especially among marginalized farmers, entrepreneurs, or members of SHG who belong to General, SC, ST categories, SHG members, PWD, Women, and Transgender individuals in Odisha. The scheme will cover all 30 districts of the State.﻿Implementation:The scheme was implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services, Odisha, Cuttack through the Chief District Veterinary Officers & their field functionaries.
Benefits: Subsidy Payment for beneficiary opted for Shed:PhaseTimeSC/ST/Women/PwD/ TransgenderGeneral1st PhaseAfter completion of the shed and purchase of 1st milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance 50% of the subsidy amount₹59,100/-₹49,250/-2nd PhaseAfter the purchase of 2nd milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance-50% of the subsidy amount₹59,100/-₹49,250/-﻿Subsidy Payment for beneficiary not opted for Shed:PhaseTimeSC/ST/Women/PwD/ TransgenderGeneral1st PhasePurchase of 1 milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance for 3 years 50% of the subsidy amount₹44,700/-₹37,250/-2nd PhaseAfter the purchase of 2nd milch graded Murrah she Buffalo & completion of its insurance for 3 years- 50% of the subsidy amount₹44,700/-₹37,250/-﻿NOTE:The beneficiaries are eligible for a back-ended subsidy of 60% for SC, ST, PWD, Women & Transgender categories and 50% for the General category. The subsidy shall be released to the beneficiary's bank account through DBT mode in 2 phases.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a farmer, entrepreneur, or member of SHG.The applicant belongs to General, SC, ST categories, SHG members, PWD, Women, and Transgender individuals.The applicant should purchase two Graded Murrah She Buffaloes, preferably in their 1st or 2nd lactation and yielding a minimum of 8 liters of milk per day.If the applicant is a PwD, their disability should be more than 40%.An individual per family will be eligible to avail assistance only once.﻿﻿
The applicant should be a farmer, entrepreneur, or member of SHG.
The applicant belongs to General, SC, ST categories, SHG members, PWD, Women, and Transgender individuals.
The applicant should purchase two Graded Murrah She Buffaloes, preferably in their 1st or 2nd lactation and yielding a minimum of 8 liters of milk per day.
If the applicant is a PwD, their disability should be more than 40%.
An individual per family will be eligible to avail assistance only once.
Application Process: OnlineRegistration Process:Step-01:The applicant need to visitGo-Sugam Portal.Step-02:Click on “Register Now” under the "Apply Button".Step-03:On the registration page, fill in the mandatory details (Name, Email, Mobile Number, Address, and Password) and click on "Register". The login credentials will be sent to applicant's registered Email ID / Mobile Number.﻿Application Process:Step-01:The applicant need to visitGo-Sugam Portal.Step-02:Click on “Scheme & Services” and then select the scheme by its name.Step-03:Click “Apply” and do login.Step-04:On the application page, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload the required documents in the appropriate file size and file type. Upon successful submission of the application, the applicant will get an Application Reference ID.﻿Check Application Status:Step-01:Click on the “Track Status” link on the menu.Step-02:Enter the Application ID or Mobile Number to get the application status.
Documents Required: Passport-size PhotographAadhaar CardBill/Money ReceiptDisability CertificateBank DetailAny Other Documents if Required
Frequently Asked Questions: Who is eligible for the scheme?Farmers from General, SC, ST categories, SHG members, PWD, Women, and Transgender individuals across all 30 districts of Odisha.What is the subsidy offered under the scheme?60% subsidy for SC, ST, PWD, Women, and Transgender categories, and 50% subsidy for the General category of the total project cost.What is the unit cost for the project?The unit cost is Rs. 1.97 lakhs for 1+1 Graded Murrah She Buffaloes.How can I apply for the scheme?Applications can be submitted through the GO-SUGAM portal.Can I apply if I do not own land?Yes, land ownership details are not mandatory for applying.Is there a time limit for purchasing the buffaloes?The first buffalo must be purchased within 60 days of the Go-ahead letter issuance, with a 15-day notice if delayed.What happens if I fail to purchase the buffalo within the given time?The Go-ahead letter will be canceled, and another beneficiary will be selected.What type of buffaloes can be purchased under this scheme?Graded Murrah She Buffaloes, preferably in their 1st or 2nd lactation and yielding a minimum of 8 liters of milk per day.Can existing buffalo sheds be used for this scheme?Yes, beneficiaries with existing sheds can opt for only animal induction and avail of the subsidy accordingly.Who verifies the assets and recommends subsidy release?The Block Level Inspection Team, comprising the BVO, VAS/AVAS, and Livestock Inspector/Veterinary Technician.Can I apply multiple times for this scheme?No, an individual per family is eligible to avail assistance only once under this scheme.How will the selection of beneficiaries be prioritized?If suitable beneficiaries of a particular category are not available, priority will be given to interchange among the subsidy eligibility categories.What if I need assistance during the implementation of the project?LIs/VTs/Gomitras/other workers will provide handholding support to the farmers.What happens if there are remaining funds after covering all targeted beneficiaries?Remaining funds can be utilized to cover more beneficiaries from the waiting list.How is the scheme monitored?The CDVO submits a monthly report on the implementation to the Directorate of AH & VS, Odisha.

knowledge_base_entry.scheme: Additional Pension to 100% Disabled Ex-Serviceman having Children
knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.

The applicant should be an Ex-serviceman. An ex-serviceman means a member of the Armed Forces who is released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work and the disability or incapacity is attributable to service.
The applicant should have 100% disability.
The benefit is provided for up to three children.
The benefit continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.
required_documents: Copy of Bank Passbook linked with Aadhaar Card
Applicant’s Photo ID Proof (Ration Card/Driving Licence/ Voter ID Card/PAN card etc.)

additional_details.meta_description: The scheme provides an additional pension to 100% disabled ex-servicemen who were members of the Armed Forces & have been released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work, provided the disability or incapacity is attributable to service.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...
table_1: ₹100/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹300/-
₹150/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹450/-
₹200/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹600/-

Details: The scheme "Additional Pension to 100% Disabled Ex-Serviceman having Children" is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under the scheme, an additional pension is provided to 100% disabled ex-servicemen who were members of the Armed Forces and have been released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work, provided the disability or incapacity is attributable to service. The additional pension amount is given only for up to three children and continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest. The additional pension will be reduced proportionately as a child dies or attains the age of 20 years or gets married or gets employed.
Benefits: The rates of additional pension admissible under the scheme are as follows:Sl. No.CategoryAdditional Pension Amount1Other Ranks₹100/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹300/-2JCO’s₹150/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹450/-3Officers₹200/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹600/-Mode of Payment:Each Secretary of District Sainik Board will make payment of additional pension on a quarterly basis by money order or in cash, as may be convenient.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.The applicant should be an Ex-serviceman. An ex-serviceman means a member of the Armed Forces who is released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work and the disability or incapacity is attributable to service.The applicant should have 100% disability.The benefit is provided for up to three children.The benefit continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.Note 1:Every eligible person shall give a certificate of eligibility on a half-yearly basis, in Form III and send it to the concerned Secretary of the District Sainik Board so as to reach him within the months of June and December every year.Note 2:As and when one or more children of the eligible person die or reach the age of 20 years or get married or secure employment, it shall be the responsibility of the eligible person/guardian to inform the Secretary of the District Sainik Board in this regard.
The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.

The applicant should be an Ex-serviceman. An ex-serviceman means a member of the Armed Forces who is released from service due to 100% disability or permanent incapacity to work and the disability or incapacity is attributable to service.
The applicant should have 100% disability.
The benefit is provided for up to three children.
The benefit continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.
Application Process: OnlineRegistration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:Step 01:The eligible applicant may apply online through the Official Portal-Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.Step 02:If the applicant is not registered on the portal, he/she gets registered there.Step 03:For registration, click “New User” under ‘Sign In Here’ and fill in all the mandatory details i.e. Name, Email ID, Mobile Number, Password & State. Click on ‘Submit’.Step 04:Verify your mobile number and email ID through the received OTP and complete the registration process.Login to apply for the scheme:Step 01:To avail the benefits of the scheme, visit the OfficialAntyodaya-SARAL Portaland log in through the email ID used while registering.Step 02:Enter Password & Captcha and click on ‘Login’.Step 03:After successful login, click on ‘Apply for Services’ and then ‘View all Available Services’Step 04:Now, you can search for the scheme and download the pre-defined Affidavit form/template and you will need to upload the filled-in/signed form/template in the 'Attach Enclosures' screen.Step 05:Click on ‘Proceed to Apply’ to fill out the application form. Enter your Parivar Pehchan Patra number- Family ID and click on “Click here to Fetch Family Data” which displays the family members registered under the given Family ID.Step 06:Select the beneficiary/applicant name and enter the OTP that is being sent to the selected family member for verification. Click on “Click to Verify”Step 07:Fill in all the mandatory details and upload all the mandatory documents.Step 08:Preview the application form and click on ‘Submit’.Tracking of Application:Applicants can track their applications through the OfficialAntyodaya-SARAL Portalby entering their Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID.
Documents Required: Copy of Ex-servicemen Identity Card.Parivar Pehchan PatraOriginal Discharge Book of Ex-servicemenDomicile Certificate of HaryanaCopy of Bank Passbook linked with Aadhaar CardApplicant’s Photo ID Proof (Ration Card/Driving Licence/ Voter ID Card/PAN card etc.)P.P.ODisability CertificateAadhaar CardAffidavitAny other documents as required
Copy of Bank Passbook linked with Aadhaar Card
Applicant’s Photo ID Proof (Ration Card/Driving Licence/ Voter ID Card/PAN card etc.)
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the eligibility criterion for the scheme?The applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana, an ex-serviceman with 100% disability attributable to service, and the pension is provided for up to three children.How much additional pension is provided for other ranks?₹100/- per child per month, subject to a maximum of ₹300/-.What is the additional pension amount for JCOs?₹150/- per child per month, subject to a maximum of ₹450/-.How much do officers receive under this scheme?₹200/- per child per month, subject to a maximum of ₹600/-.How is the additional pension paid out?Payment is made on a quarterly basis by money order or in cash.Where can one apply for this scheme?Applications can be made online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal: https://saralharyana.gov.in/How long does the pension continue for a child?Until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed.Is the pension amount reduced if a child becomes ineligible?Yes, the pension is reduced proportionately as a child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed.Can the pension be received for more than three children?No, the benefit is provided for up to three children only.

The widow should be a resident of Haryana.
The benefit is provided for up to three children of the widow.
The benefit continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.

Details: The scheme "Additional Pension to Widow of Ex-Serviceman having Children" is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under the scheme, an additional amount, in addition to the pension, is provided to the widow of an ex-serviceman who dies while in service but not in any battle. This additional amount is given for up to three children and continues until the child dies, reaches the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest. The additional pension will be reduced proportionately as a child dies or attains the age of 20 years or gets married or gets employed.
Benefits: The rates of additional pension admissible under the scheme are as follows:Sl. No.CategoryAdditional Pension Amount1Other Ranks₹100/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹300/-2JCO’s₹150/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹450/-3Officers₹200/- per child per month subject to a maximum of ₹600/-Mode of Payment:Each Secretary of District Sainik Board will make payment of additional pension on a quarterly basis by money order or in cash, as may be convenient.
Eligibility: The applicant should be the widow of an ex-serviceman. A ‘widow’ means the widow of a member of the Armed Forces whose death has taken place while in service but not in any battle.The widow should be a resident of Haryana.The benefit is provided for up to three children of the widow.The benefit continues until the child dies, attains the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.Note 1:Every eligible widow shall give a certificate of eligibility on a half-yearly basis, in Form III and send it to the concerned Secretary of the District Sainik Board so as to reach them within the months of June and December every year.Note 2:As and when one or more children of the eligible person die or reach the age of 20 years or get married or secure employment, it shall be responsibility of the eligible widow to inform the Secretary of the District Sainik Board in this regard.

Frequently Asked Questions: Who is eligible for this scheme?The widow of an ex-serviceman who died while in service (not in battle) and who has up to three children is eligible. The widow must be a resident of Haryana.How long does the benefit continue?The benefit continues until each child of the widow dies, reaches the age of 20 years, gets married, or becomes employed, whichever is the earliest.What are the benefits provided under this scheme?The rates of additional pension vary based on the rank of the ex-serviceman: ₹100/- per child per month for Other Ranks, ₹150/- per child per month for JCO’s, and ₹200/- per child per month for Officers, subject to maximum limits.How is the additional pension paid?The additional pension is paid on a quarterly basis by money order or in cash, as convenient, by the Secretary of District Sainik Board.How can an eligible applicant apply for this scheme?Eligible applicants can apply online through the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.Is there any specific residency requirement?Yes, the widow must be a resident of Haryana to avail of this scheme.What happens if a child of the widow dies or reaches 20 years of age, gets married, or becomes employed?The additional pension will be reduced proportionately, and it is the responsibility of the widow to inform the Secretary of the District Sainik Board about such events.What is the definition of a 'widow' under this scheme?A widow of a member of the Armed Forces whose death occurred while in service but not in any battle.How often must the widow submit a certificate of eligibility?On a half-yearly basis, in June and December.Can the benefit be claimed for more than three children?No, the benefit is limited to up to three children.

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.

benefits: Under this scheme, loans up to ₹10,00,000/- are provided to persons with disabilities for agricultural production, irrigation, horticulture, sericulture, purchasing agricultural machinery/equipment for agricultural services, marketing agricultural products, etc.

additional_details.meta_description: This scheme provides loans up to ₹10,00,000/- to the persons with disabilities for agricultural production, irrigation, horticulture, sericulture, the purchase of agricultural machinery and equipment for agricultural services, and the marketing of agricultural products etc.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: The scheme "Agricultural Activities for Persons with Disabilities" is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, loans up to ₹10,00,000/- are provided to individuals identified as persons with disabilities for agricultural production, irrigation, horticulture, sericulture, the purchase of agricultural machinery and equipment for agricultural services, and the marketing of agricultural products etc. Permanent residents of Haryana, aged 18 years or older, with a disability of 40% or more, are eligible under this scheme.
Benefits: Under this scheme, loans up to ₹10,00,000/- are provided to persons with disabilities for agricultural production, irrigation, horticulture, sericulture, purchasing agricultural machinery/equipment for agricultural services, marketing agricultural products, etc.

Click on ‘Submit’.Step 04:Verify your mobile number and email ID through the received OTP and complete the registration process.Login to apply for the scheme:Step 01:To avail the benefits of the scheme, visit the OfficialAntyodaya-SARAL Portaland log in through the email ID used while registering.Step 02:Enter Password & Captcha and click on ‘Login’.Step 03:After successful login, click on ‘Apply for Services’ and then ‘View all Available Services’Step 04: Now, you can search for the scheme and click on the scheme to go ahead and fill out the application form.Step 05:Fill in all the mandatory details and upload all the mandatory documents.Step 06:Preview the application form and click on ‘Submit’.Tracking of Application:Applicants can track their applications through the OfficialAntyodaya-SARAL Portalby entering their Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID.

Frequently Asked Questions: What is the maximum loan amount provided under this scheme?Loans up to ₹10,00,000/- are provided.What are the purposes for which the loan can be used?The loan can be used for agricultural production, irrigation, horticulture, sericulture, purchasing agricultural machinery/equipment, and marketing agricultural products.Is there an age relaxation for persons with mental retardation?Yes, for persons with mental retardation, the age requirement is relaxed to 14 years instead of 18 years.What is the minimum disability percentage required to be eligible for the scheme?A minimum of 40% disability is required.Is the scheme available for individuals outside Haryana?No, only permanent residents of Haryana are eligible for this scheme.How can eligible applicants apply for the scheme?Applicants can apply online through the Official Portal- Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.How can applicants track their application status?Applicants can track their applications through the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal by entering their Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID at https://status.saralharyana.nic.in/.

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
The applicant should be an artisan.
The applicant should be engaged in traditional profession crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, papermaking, ringaal, natural fibre crafts, etc.
The applicant's age should be 60 years or above.
The applicant is already receiving an old-age pension from the government.
The applicant should belong to a BPL (Below Poverty Line) family.
If the artisan's son or grandson is aged 20 years or more and the family still lives below the poverty line, the applicant remains eligible.
The applicant should be approved as an artisan under criteria set by the state government from time to time.

Details: The "Pension Scheme for Artisans" was launched by the Department of Industries, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to provide financial security and dignity to senior traditional artisans aged 60 years and above. Under this scheme, artisans who are already receiving an old-age pension and belong to a family living below the poverty line are granted an additional incentive of ₹400/- per month.ObjectiveThe scheme supports artisans involved in traditional crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, ringaal, natural fibres, etc., particularly those from below-poverty-line (BPL) families.
Benefits: The monthly incentive of ₹400 is provided to senior artisans who are already receiving old-age pension.Note:Payment is made quarterly (every 3 months) via the bank account or post office account of the beneficiary.
The monthly incentive of ₹400 is provided to senior artisans who are already receiving old-age pension.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be an artisan.The applicant should be engaged in traditional profession crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, papermaking, ringaal, natural fibre crafts, etc.The applicant's age should be 60 years or above.The applicant is already receiving an old-age pension from the government.The applicant should belong to a BPL (Below Poverty Line) family.If the artisan's son or grandson is aged 20 years or more and the family still lives below the poverty line, the applicant remains eligible.The applicant should be approved as an artisan under criteria set by the state government from time to time.
The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
The applicant should be an artisan.
The applicant should be engaged in traditional profession crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, papermaking, ringaal, natural fibre crafts, etc.
The applicant's age should be 60 years or above.
The applicant is already receiving an old-age pension from the government.
The applicant should belong to a BPL (Below Poverty Line) family.
If the artisan's son or grandson is aged 20 years or more and the family still lives below the poverty line, the applicant remains eligible.
The applicant should be approved as an artisan under criteria set by the state government from time to time.
Application Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1:The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the General Manager, District Industries Centre and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.ORThe interested applicant downloads the application form from theofficial website.Step 2:In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3:Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the General Manager, District Industries Centre.Post-application Process:Step 1:A district-level committee, chaired by the General Manager, DIC, reviews and verifies all applications.Step 2:Eligible artisans are selected based on documents and eligibility norms.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card CopyBank Account DetailsOld-Age Pension CertificateBPL CertificateDate of Birth Proof (Birth Certificate or Aadhaar)Certified Copy of Family RegisterProof of Being a Recognized Artisan (Certificate from authorized body)
Date of Birth Proof (Birth Certificate or Aadhaar)
Proof of Being a Recognized Artisan (Certificate from authorized body)
Frequently Asked Questions: Who is eligible for this scheme?Artisans aged 60 or more, receiving old-age pension, and from BPL families.What is the benefit amount?₹400/- per month as an additional incentive.How often is the benefit paid?Every three months (quarterly).Can artisans not receiving old-age pension apply?No, it is mandatory to be an existing recipient of old-age pension.Do I need to prove that I am an artisan?Yes, a certificate or document is required as proof of artisan status.Can I apply online?No, the form can be downloaded fromhttps://doiuk.org.inor collect the form from General Manager, District Industries Centre.Where do I get help if I face any issues?Visit or contact the General Manager of the District Industries Centre in your district.Where should the form be submitted?Submission is physical to the General Manager, District Industries Centre.Is there a selection process?Yes, by a district-level committee led by the DIC General Manager.What documents are required for application?The document Aadhaar Card Copy, Bank Account Details (Passbook Copy), Old-Age Pension Certificate, BPL Certificate, Date of Birth Proof (Birth Certificate or Aadhaar), Certified Copy of Family Register, Proof of Being a Recognized Artisan, etc.

knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
benefits: Financial Assistance:An amount between ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- for purchasing various farm implements.

additional_details.meta_description: The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" launched by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, offers financial assistance ranging from ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- to farmers in Gujarat for purchasing agricultural machinery and farm equipment.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" launched by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to farmers for the purchase of various modern farm implements and machinery. The scheme promotes mechanized farming and ensures timely agricultural operations for better yield and efficiency.﻿﻿
Benefits: Financial Assistance:An amount between ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- for purchasing various farm implements.
Financial Assistance:An amount between ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- for purchasing various farm implements.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.﻿﻿﻿﻿
The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
Application Process: OnlineStep 1:The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal:https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2:On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3:Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4:Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5:Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6:Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7:Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8:Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link:https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspxContact Us:Click here.
Documents Required: 7/12 Certificate (land ownership proof).Aadhaar Card.Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque.
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme"?The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" is a state government initiative in Gujarat that provides financial assistance to farmers for purchasing modern agricultural machinery.Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?Any individual who is a farmer and a resident of Gujarat is eligible to apply for this scheme, regardless of caste, income, or social status.﻿﻿What types of machinery are supported under this scheme?The scheme supports the purchase of various farm implements such as tractors, power tillers, seed drills, threshers, and other agricultural tools.﻿﻿How much financial assistance can a farmer receive under this scheme?A farmer can receive financial assistance ranging from ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- depending on the type and cost of the machinery.﻿﻿How is the subsidy amount disbursed to the applicant?The approved subsidy amount is directly credited to the applicant's bank account.﻿﻿How can a farmer apply for the scheme?A farmer can apply online through the officiali-Khedutportal of the Gujarat government by filling in the application form and uploading the required documents.﻿﻿What documents must be submitted with the application?The applicant must submit a copy of the 7/12 land record, Aadhaar card, and a bank passbook or a cancelled cheque.﻿﻿What are the consequences of submitting false information in the application?If false or incorrect information is submitted, the application may be rejected, and the applicant could face legal action.﻿﻿Where can applicants seek help if they face difficulties during the application process?Applicants can visit the nearest agriculture office or contact the helpline number provided on the ikhedut portal for assistance.

Details: The scheme "Construction of Water Storage Tanks for Drip Irrigation" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat,  aims to offer financial assistance to farmers for setting up cemented water tanks essential for efficient drip irrigation.  It supports sustainable agriculture through water conservation, especially for horticultural practices.
Benefits: Unit cost of construction:₹1,00,000/- per tank.For General category farmers:50% subsidy, up to ₹50,000/-.For SC/ST farmers:75% subsidy, up to ₹75,000/-.
Unit cost of construction:₹1,00,000/- per tank.
For General category farmers:50% subsidy, up to ₹50,000/-.
For SC/ST farmers:75% subsidy, up to ₹75,000/-.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant must plan to construct a cemented water storage tank of at least 25.50 cubic meters capacity.Note:Cemented mature water tanks, drip set mandatory.
The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
The applicant must plan to construct a cemented water storage tank of at least 25.50 cubic meters capacity.
Application Process: OnlineStep 1:The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal:https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/﻿Step 2:On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.Step 3:Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.Step 4:Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5:Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6:Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7:Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8:Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link:https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspxContact Us:Click here.
Documents Required: 7/12 Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.Note:For reasonableness of the cost of the tank, a certificate regarding the cost of the tank from the Government Valuer/Taluka Surveyor/ MNREGA surveyor will have to be provided by the beneficiary.
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the objective of the "Construction of Water Storage Tanks for Drip Irrigation" scheme?The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for constructing water storage tanks to support efficient drip irrigation practices.﻿Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?Any farmer residing in Gujarat who intends to install a cemented water tank for drip irrigation can apply for the scheme.What is the subsidy amount offered to general category farmers?General category farmers are eligible to receive 50% of the tank’s construction cost, up to a maximum of ₹50,000/-.﻿﻿What financial assistance is provided to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe farmers?Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe farmers can receive 75% of the cost, limited to a maximum of ₹75,000/-.﻿Is there a minimum size requirement for the water tank?Yes, the tank must have a minimum storage capacity of 25.50 cubic meters to be eligible for assistance.What type of tank is permitted under this scheme?Only cemented water storage tanks are allowed under this scheme.﻿﻿Is the installation of a drip irrigation set mandatory?Yes, installation of a drip irrigation set is compulsory as part of the scheme requirements.﻿﻿Can a farmer apply for the scheme more than once?No, the benefit under this scheme can be availed only once per account on the i-Khedut portal.﻿﻿Where can a farmer submit an application for the scheme?Applicants can apply on theiKhedutportal to avail the benefits of the scheme.Is it necessary to submit a cost estimation certificate for the tank?Yes, applicants must submit a certified cost estimate from a Government Valuer, Taluka Surveyor, or MNREGA Surveyor.﻿﻿Is there any income limit for eligibility under this scheme?No, there is no income limit for individual or family income under this scheme.﻿﻿What documents are required to apply for this scheme?Applicants need to submit their Aadhaar card, 7/12 land record, caste certificate (if applicable), bank passbook or cancelled cheque, and tank cost certificate.﻿﻿Who should the applicant contact for help or more information about the scheme?The applicant should contact the nearest agriculture office or visit theiKhedutportal for more information.

Details: The scheme "Uttarakhand State Shilp Ratna Award" is implemented by the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to honor exceptionally skilled artisans of the state for their outstanding contributions to the traditional craft sector. This annual award celebrates heritage, promotes excellence, and supports artisans whose expertise has preserved and enriched cultural craftsmanship.
Benefits: Award Details:A cash prize of ₹1,00,000/-.A memento (symbolic representation).An angavastra (ceremonial stole).A certificate of appreciation.

Details: The scheme "Travel Grants To Goan Authors" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their own within India to acquaint them with the writers and the people of that region, and to widen their awareness and sensibility about the country as a nation.
Benefits: The grant amount will be decided by Kala Academy with provision for an advance upto 75% of the total grant for a maximum of two Goan authors.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a writer.The applicant should be from Goa.*A copy of the rules and regulations is available at Kala Academy free of charge.
The applicant should be a writer.
The applicant should be from Goa.
Application Process: OfflineStep 1:The entries are invited by releasing press announcements in local print and electronic media. The announcement consists of the proforma prescribed by the Kala Academy for application to the scheme.Step 2:In the provided entry form, the interested applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the supporting documents.Step 3:Submit the duly filled and signed form along with the supporting documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to theMember Secretary, Kala Academy, Goa, Campal, Panaji.Step 4:Applications are placed before the Advisory Committee (Literature of Kala Academy) for their recommendation and subsequent approval by the authorities of Kala Academy.Authority for Redressal of Grievances:Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa.
Documents Required: Detailed Biodata.Travel Plan Within Stipulated Time.
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the purpose of this travel grant scheme for authors, and how will it benefit me as a writer?The scheme enables Goan writers to connect with senior writers from other language regions within India, helping them broaden their awareness and understanding of the country’s literary and cultural diversity.How many authors are selected for the travel grant each year under this program?A maximum of two Goan authors are selected annually for the travel grant.Where can I find the complete rules and regulations regarding eligibility for this travel grant?The rules and regulations are available free of cost at Kala Academy.How does the selection process work for choosing authors who receive the travel grant?Applications are reviewed by the Advisory Committee (Literature of Kala Academy), which makes recommendations for final approval by Kala Academy’s authorities.What is the procedure for applying, and what documents must I submit with my application?Applicants must submit a duly filled prescribed entry form along with a detailed biodata and travel plan within the specified deadline.Is there any financial assistance provided, and how much can I expect to receive as a grant?The grant amount is decided by Kala Academy, with an advance of up to 75% of the total grant available.What are the financial requirements after receiving the travel grant, and what documents must I submit post-travel?Upon completing the journey, the author must submit a final bill along with a detailed tour report to Kala Academy.Who is the designated authority responsible for receiving and processing the travel grant applications?The Member Secretary of Kala Academy, Goa, is the authority responsible for receiving applications.If I face any issues or have grievances regarding the application process, whom should I contact?Grievances can be addressed to either the Member Secretary or the Chairman of Kala Academy, Goa.How are applicants informed about the opening of applications for this travel grant scheme?Press announcements are released in local print and electronic media to invite entries from interested authors.Is there a specific deadline for submitting the application, and where can I find this information?The stipulated deadline for submission will be mentioned in the press announcements released by Kala Academy.Do I need to provide a detailed travel plan as part of my application, and what should it include?Yes, a detailed travel plan must be submitted along with the application, outlining the intended journey and engagement with writers from another region.Can I apply if I am a writer from outside Goa but currently residing in the state?The scheme is specifically for Goan authors; residency or origin eligibility details should be confirmed with Kala Academy.Is there any restriction on the language or region I can visit under this travel grant?The scheme encourages interaction with writers from a language-region other than the applicant’s own within India.
