knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a member of the Employees' Provident Fund Scheme, 1952, or an exempted establishment under Section 17 of the Act.
The applicant's pay must not exceed ₹15,000/month (unless contributing additional 1.16% above this limit).
The applicant must have a minimum of 10 years of eligible service for pension.
The applicant must have contributed to the Employees' Pension Fund.
The applicant must be 58 years or above in age.
The applicant must have rendered at least 10 years of eligible service.
The applicant must have rendered at least 10 years of eligible service.
The applicant must opt for early pension between 50 and 58 years of age.
The applicant must be the spouse or child of a deceased member who met the eligibility criteria.
The applicant must provide proof of the relationship and the member's death.
The deceased member must have contributed for at least one month.
The applicant must submit the required documents for verification.
The applicant must comply with EPFO guidelines for pension disbursement.
benefits: Superannuation Pension:Payable to members who retire at 58 years with at least 10 years of eligible service. Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.
Early Pension:Reduced pension for members retiring between 50-58 years, with a 4% reduction per year below 58. Payable if the member has rendered eligible service of 10 years or more.
Monthly Member's Pension:Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.
Minimum Pension:₹1,000 per month, subject to deductions for commutation or early pension.
Widow Pension:50% of the member's pension or ₹450/month, whichever is higher.
Children Pension:25% of widow pension per child (max 2 children).
Orphan Pension:75% of the widow pension if no surviving spouse (max 2 orphans).
Permanent Total Disablement Pension:Minimum ₹250/- per month if the member is permanently disabled during service.
Withdrawal Benefit:For members who exit before completing 10 years of service, calculated as per Table D.
Pension starts from the date following the member's retirement, disablement, or death.
Early pension is reduced by 4% for each year the age falls short of 58 years.
Deferred pension increases by 4% for each year beyond 58 years, up to 60 years.
Family pension ceases on widow's remarriage or death.
required_documents: Proof of Date of Birth (Birth certificate/School leaving certificate)
Disability Certificate, from EPFO-approved doctors (for disablement pension)

additional_details.meta_description: The scheme ensures retirement security for employees covered under the EPF Act, offering monthly pensions, family pensions, and withdrawal benefits. It targets workers in organised sectors, providing financial support post-retirement, during disability, or to dependents after the member’s death.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: Launched on 16th November 1995, the "Employees' Pension Scheme" is a social security initiative by the Government of India, implemented under the Employees' Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952. The scheme ensures financial security for employees post-retirement, disability, or to their families in case of death. Key benefits include superannuation pension, early pension, and family pension. Eligible employees must be members of the Employees' Provident Fund Scheme, 1952, and their pay should not exceed ₹15,000/- per month. The scheme is implemented by the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). Applications for this scheme are accepted both online and offline through EPFO portals and regional offices.
Benefits: Superannuation Pension:Payable to members who retire at 58 years with at least 10 years of eligible service. Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.Early Pension:Reduced pension for members retiring between 50-58 years, with a 4% reduction per year below 58. Payable if the member has rendered eligible service of 10 years or more.Monthly Member's Pension:Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.Minimum Pension:₹1,000 per month, subject to deductions for commutation or early pension.Widow Pension:50% of the member's pension or ₹450/month, whichever is higher.Children Pension:25% of widow pension per child (max 2 children).Orphan Pension:75% of the widow pension if no surviving spouse (max 2 orphans).Permanent Total Disablement Pension:Minimum ₹250/- per month if the member is permanently disabled during service.Withdrawal Benefit:For members who exit before completing 10 years of service, calculated as per Table D.﻿Disbursement ConditionsPension starts from the date following the member's retirement, disablement, or death.Early pension is reduced by 4% for each year the age falls short of 58 years.Deferred pension increases by 4% for each year beyond 58 years, up to 60 years.Family pension ceases on widow's remarriage or death.Mode of Disbursement:Through Post Office, Nationalised Banks, or electronic transfer.
Superannuation Pension:Payable to members who retire at 58 years with at least 10 years of eligible service. Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.
Early Pension:Reduced pension for members retiring between 50-58 years, with a 4% reduction per year below 58. Payable if the member has rendered eligible service of 10 years or more.
Monthly Member's Pension:Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.
Minimum Pension:₹1,000 per month, subject to deductions for commutation or early pension.
Widow Pension:50% of the member's pension or ₹450/month, whichever is higher.
Children Pension:25% of widow pension per child (max 2 children).
Orphan Pension:75% of the widow pension if no surviving spouse (max 2 orphans).
Permanent Total Disablement Pension:Minimum ₹250/- per month if the member is permanently disabled during service.
Withdrawal Benefit:For members who exit before completing 10 years of service, calculated as per Table D.

Early pension is reduced by 4% for each year the age falls short of 58 years.
Deferred pension increases by 4% for each year beyond 58 years, up to 60 years.
Family pension ceases on widow's remarriage or death.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a member of the Employees' Provident Fund Scheme, 1952, or an exempted establishment under Section 17 of the Act.The applicant's pay must not exceed ₹15,000/month (unless contributing additional 1.16% above this limit).The applicant must have a minimum of 10 years of eligible service for pension.The applicant must have contributed to the Employees' Pension Fund.For Superannuation PensionThe applicant must be 58 years or above in age.The applicant must have rendered at least 10 years of eligible service.For Early PensionThe applicant must have rendered at least 10 years of eligible service.The applicant must opt for early pension between 50 and 58 years of age.For Family PensionThe applicant must be the spouse or child of a deceased member who met the eligibility criteria.The applicant must provide proof of the relationship and the member's death.The deceased member must have contributed for at least one month.Post-Selection ConditionsThe applicant must submit the required documents for verification.The applicant must comply with EPFO guidelines for pension disbursement.﻿*International workers are eligible under specific social security agreements.

The applicant must have contributed to the Employees' Pension Fund.

The applicant must opt for early pension between 50 and 58 years of age.
The applicant must be the spouse or child of a deceased member who met the eligibility criteria.
The applicant must provide proof of the relationship and the member's death.
The deceased member must have contributed for at least one month.
The applicant must submit the required documents for verification.
The applicant must comply with EPFO guidelines for pension disbursement.
Application Process: OnlineFor RegistrationStep 1: Activate UAN (Universal Account Number)Visit theEPFO Unified Portal. Click "For Employees" > "Member UAN/Online Services (OCS/OTCP)". Enter UAN, mobile number, and CAPTCHA code. Click "Request OTP". Enter the OTP received on your registered mobile and click "Validate OTP". You will be redirected to the UAN activation page.Step 2: Set Password & Complete KYCCreate a password (8-12 characters, including 1 uppercase, 1 number, and 1 special character). Under "Manage", select "KYC" and upload documents (Aadhaar, PAN, bank details). KYC status will show as "Approved" after verification (takes 3-5 working days).﻿For ApplicationStep 1: Login to the EPFO PortalGo toEPFO Unified Portal. Click "Member e-Sewa" > Enter UAN, password, and CAPTCHA. Click "Sign In". You will land on the member dashboard.Step 2: Navigate to Pension ClaimUnder "Online Services", select "Pension on Superannuation/Retirement (Form 10D)". The pension application form will open. Fill in all the mandatory fields. Click "Save & Preview" to review entries.Step 3: Upload DocumentsUpload scanned copies (PDF/JPEG/PNG, max 2MB each). Click "Submit" to proceed to OTP verification.Step 4: OTP Verification & Final SubmissionEnter the OTP sent to your registered mobile and email. Click "Validate OTP & Submit". A success message with an acknowledgement number will appear. Save the acknowledgement number and screenshot of submission confirmation for future reference.﻿C. Application Status TrackingMethod 1:EPFO Portal > "Track Claim Status" (using UAN + acknowledgement number).Method 2:SMS "EPFOHO <UAN> ENG" to 7738299899.﻿D. Help & Support / Grievance RedressalEPFO Helpline:1800-118-005 (8:00 AM–8:00 PM).Email:epfigms@epfindia.gov.in.Online Grievance Portal:EPFiGMS(or visit the nearest office for grievances).
Documents Required: Identity Proof (Aadhaar/Passport/Voter ID)Bank Account Details (Cancelled cheque/passbook copy)Proof of Date of Birth (Birth certificate/School leaving certificate)Death Certificate (for family pension)relationship proof (for family pension)Disability Certificate, from EPFO-approved doctors (for disablement pension)Service Proof (EPF passbook/employment records)
Proof of Date of Birth (Birth certificate/School leaving certificate)
Disability Certificate, from EPFO-approved doctors (for disablement pension)
Frequently Asked Questions: What are the minimum years of service required to be eligible for pension benefits under this scheme?The applicant must have completed a minimum of 10 years of contributory service under the Employees' Provident Fund to qualify for pension benefits.How is the monthly member's pension calculated under this scheme?The pension amount is calculated using the formula: (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70. The result determines the monthly payout.What is the minimum pension amount guaranteed under this scheme?The minimum pension provided is ₹1,000 per month, subject to deductions for commutation or early pension adjustments.Who is eligible to receive a family pension after the member's death?The deceased member's spouse is eligible for 50% of the pension, while children receive 25% each, up to a maximum of two children.What happens if a member exits the scheme before completing 10 years of service?Members who exit before 10 years receive a withdrawal benefit, calculated as per Table D of the scheme's provisions.At what age does the superannuation pension become payable under this scheme?The superannuation pension is payable once the member attains 58 years of age, provided they have at least 10 years of service.Can a member claim an early pension before reaching 58 years of age?Yes, early pension can be claimed between 50 and 58 years, but it is reduced by 4% for each year below 58.What documents are required to apply for a family pension after a member's death?The applicant must submit the member's death certificate along with proof of relationship, such as a marriage or birth certificate.How is the pension amount adjusted if a member delays claiming it beyond 58 years?For each year deferred beyond 58, the pension increases by 4%, up to a maximum of 60 years of age.What is the orphan pension, and who is eligible to receive it?Orphan pension is 75% of the widow's pension, payable if there is no surviving spouse and only dependent children.What is the pension benefit for a member who becomes permanently disabled during service?A minimum of ₹250 per month is provided as a permanent total disablement pension if disability occurs during employment.How can a member track the status of their pension application online?The status can be checked on the EPFO portal using the UAN and acknowledgement number or via the SMS service.What is the process for activating the Universal Account Number (UAN) for online services?Visit the EPFO Unified Portal, enter UAN and mobile details, validate OTP, and set a password to activate the UAN.What are the password requirements for accessing the EPFO member portal?The password must be 8-12 characters long, with at least 1 uppercase letter, 1 number, and 1 special character.What is the maximum file size allowed for document uploads during online application?Scanned documents must be in PDF, JPEG, or PNG format, with a maximum size of 2 MB per file.What should an applicant do if their pension claim is delayed beyond the expected timeline?Delays beyond 20 working days incur a 12% penal interest, and grievances can be raised via EPFiGMS or helpline.What is the validity period of the OTP used during the online application process?The OTP sent for verification remains valid for 10 minutes before expiring.Is there a helpline available for assistance regarding pension-related queries?Yes, the EPFO helpline (1800-118-005) operates from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM for support and grievance redressal.
Sources And References: Employees' Pension Scheme, 1995 (Original Notification)Amendment Dated 14.06.2024EPF Act, 1952 (Parent Legislation)EPFO Unified Member PortalForm 10D (Pension Claim Form)EPFiGMS (Grievance Portal)FAQ On EPSSMS Service For Claim TrackingSocial Security Agreements (International Workers)

knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant's age should be 18 years or more.
The applicant should be a permanent resident of Rajasthan.

The women's self-help group or group of these groups (cluster/ federation) must be registered under any department of the state government and in case of cluster/federation of groups, it will be necessary to be registered under the Cooperative Act as per the rules.
benefits: Loan amount of ₹ 50,00,000/- to individual women.
Loan amount of Rs 1,00,00,000/- to self-help groups.

A margin money of 25% of the sanctioned loan amount will be provided under the scheme. For women belonging to Scheduled Castes/Tribes, Scheduled Castes, widows, abandoned women, victims of violence and disabled women, the margin money will be 30% of the sanctioned loan amount.
Note:
The maximum limit of margin money will be ₹ 15,00,000/-.
The applicant's own contribution (5% / 10% of the project proposal) will be considered for margin money.

Land value will not be included in the project proposal. The maximum limit of loan amount payable for construction of workshop/building will be up to 20% of the sanctioned amount of the project proposal.
The maximum limit of loan for business will be Rs. 10 lakh. Business refers to wholesale or retail purchase-sale of commercial products.

As per the guidelines of the Reserve Bank of India, collateral security will not be required for loans up to Rs. 10 lakh. Loans above Rs. 10 lakh can be linked with the Credit Guarantee Trust Fund for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE). The fee amount will be borne by the beneficiary. If the applicant voluntarily wants to give collateral security on the loan, they can do so.

Click on the ‘Verify OTP’ button to Complete the registration.
Google : Enter the Gmail ID, click on the ‘Next’ button,
Enter the password.
A new link appear on screen, now click on new SSO link.
SSO id will appear on screen, now create the password.
Enter Mobile number, click on registration.

Details: The Indira Mahila Shakti Udyam Protsahan Yojana (IMSUPY) is a scheme launched by the Rajasthan government to empower women entrepreneurs by providing them with financial assistance and support. The main objective of the scheme is to ecourage women to start their own businesses and become financially independent. Promote self-employment and reduce unemployment among women in Rajasthan. Support the growth of micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) led by women.

The maximum limit of loan amount payable for construction of workshop/building will be up to 20% of the sanctioned amount of the project proposal.The maximum limit of loan for business will be Rs. 10 lakh. Loans above Rs. 10 lakh can be linked with the Credit Guarantee Trust Fund for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE). The fee amount will be borne by the beneficiary. If the applicant voluntarily wants to give collateral security on the loan, they can do so.﻿

knowledge_base_entry.scheme: PMMSY: Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries-Haryana
knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
The freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 15 million fry per year per unit or 6.00 crore spawn per year per unit.
The hatchery should have a minimum area of 0.50 hectares.
The fish hatchery should be managed by qualified technical staff.
The applicant will ensure the supply of seed produced from the centrally assisted hatcheries to farmers at an affordable and reasonable price.
The fish hatchery will include a brooder pond, nursery ponds, rearing tanks, a small laboratory, water and electric supply, and required infrastructure facilities.
The cost of accreditation of the hatchery must be mandatorily included in the project estimates.
The projects having land on long-term registered lease will also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme.
The lease period or agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 years.
The applicant, having their own land, must furnish revenue records with a clear land title.
benefits: The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category.
The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category or women beneficiaries.
required_documents: Agreement Deed between the beneficiary and the Fisheries Department.
Date Of Birth Certificate (Voting Card/Birth Certificate/Aadhar Card/Matriculation Certificate).
Land Record from Tehsil (Own Land - Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra, Farad) or Registered Lease Deed of minimum 10 years.
Photographs of the hatchery with the beneficiary.
Details of Bank Account and Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.
Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) as per Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) guidelines.

additional_details.meta_description: The scheme aims to support the establishment of new freshwater finfish hatcheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to beneficiaries for setting up these hatcheries.

Details: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to support the establishment of new freshwater finfish hatcheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to beneficiaries for setting up these hatcheries.﻿﻿
Benefits: The project cost for one unit is ₹25,00,000/-.The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category.The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category or women beneficiaries.﻿﻿
The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category.
The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category or women beneficiaries.
Eligibility: The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).The freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 15 million fry per year per unit or 6.00 crore spawn per year per unit.The hatchery should have a minimum area of 0.50 hectares.The fish hatchery should be managed by qualified technical staff.The applicant will ensure the supply of seed produced from the centrally assisted hatcheries to farmers at an affordable and reasonable price.The fish hatchery will include a brooder pond, nursery ponds, rearing tanks, a small laboratory, water and electric supply, and required infrastructure facilities.The cost of accreditation of the hatchery must be mandatorily included in the project estimates.The projects having land on long-term registered lease will also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme.The lease period or agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 years.The applicant, having their own land, must furnish revenue records with a clear land title.
The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
The freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 15 million fry per year per unit or 6.00 crore spawn per year per unit.
The hatchery should have a minimum area of 0.50 hectares.
The fish hatchery should be managed by qualified technical staff.
The applicant will ensure the supply of seed produced from the centrally assisted hatcheries to farmers at an affordable and reasonable price.
The fish hatchery will include a brooder pond, nursery ponds, rearing tanks, a small laboratory, water and electric supply, and required infrastructure facilities.
The cost of accreditation of the hatchery must be mandatorily included in the project estimates.
The projects having land on long-term registered lease will also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme.
The lease period or agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 years.
The applicant, having their own land, must furnish revenue records with a clear land title.

Land Record from Tehsil (Own Land - Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra, Farad) or Registered Lease Deed of minimum 10 years.
Photographs of the hatchery with the beneficiary.

Frequently Asked Questions: What is the minimum capacity required for a freshwater finfish hatchery under this scheme in terms of fry production?A freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 15 million fry per year per unit.What is the minimum capacity required for a freshwater finfish hatchery under this scheme in terms of spawn production?A freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 6.00 crore spawn per year per unit.What is the minimum area required for a freshwater finfish hatchery to be eligible for this scheme?The minimum area required for a freshwater finfish hatchery is 0.50 hectares.Who is responsible for managing the fish hatchery according to the scheme's requirements?The fish hatchery should be managed by required qualified technical staff.What is the beneficiary's responsibility regarding the supply of seed produced from the hatcheries?The beneficiary should ensure the supply of seed produced from the centrally assisted hatcheries to farmers at an affordable and reasonable price.What are some of the essential facilities that a fish hatchery must include?A fish hatchery should include a brooder pond, nursery ponds, rearing tanks, a small laboratory, water and electric supply, and required infrastructure facilities.Is the cost of accreditation of the hatchery included in the project estimates?Yes, the cost of accreditation of the hatchery will be mandatorily included in the project estimates.Can projects on leased land be considered for financial assistance under this scheme?Yes, projects having land on long-term registered lease can be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme.What is the minimum required lease period for land to be considered for this scheme?The lease period or agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 years.What document must a beneficiary with their own land furnish?The beneficiary, having their own land, should furnish a revenue record with a clear land title.What documents can be submitted as proof of date of birth?Voting Card, Birth Certificate, Aadhar Card, or Matriculation Certificate can be submitted as proof of date of birth.From whom should the Caste Certificate be obtained?The Caste Certificate should be obtained from a first-class Magistrate (Tehsildar).What land records are required for beneficiaries with their own land?For their own land, Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra, and Farad from the Tehsil are required.

knowledge_base_entry.summary: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste.
This facility will be given one time only.
benefits: Reimbursement of ₹1,000/- or the actual cost of a second-class train ticket (to and fro) per person, whichever is less, will be provided.
required_documents: Copy of Scheduled Castes Certificate (along with original)
Undertaking Regarding Non-Government Employee (including Boards/Corporations/Authorities/Government Undertakings and such Establishments)
application_steps: The number of persons are fixed for registration, i.e. 100 per constituency. Registration will be done on a first-come, first-served basis.
Reimbursement will be made after journey on the submission of railway tickets.
The budget will be allotted to the District Welfare officers for this purpose.

additional_details.meta_description: This scheme aims to facilitate pilgrimages to Varanasi and Amritsar for individuals belonging to the Scheduled Castes category. The scheme provides financial reimbursement for second-class train travel, enabling eligible beneficiaries to undertake these religious journeys with ease.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: The "Varanasi and Amritsar Yatra Scheme" is a scheme under the "Celebration of Birth Anniversaries of Great saints Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, Guru Ravidas, Maharishi Valmiki and Sant Kabir Dass Jayanti Scheme", implemented by the Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana. This scheme aims to facilitate pilgrimages to Varanasi and Amritsar for individuals belonging to the Scheduled Castes category. To support their spiritual and cultural engagement, the scheme provides financial reimbursement for second-class train travel, enabling eligible beneficiaries to undertake these religious journeys with ease.﻿
Benefits: Reimbursement of ₹1,000/- or the actual cost of a second-class train ticket (to and fro) per person, whichever is less, will be provided.Note:This facility will be given one time only.Expected Time of Disbursement:Reimbursement will be made after the journey on the submission of railway tickets.Mode of Disbursement:Payment will be made directly into the bank account of the beneficiary.﻿
Reimbursement of ₹1,000/- or the actual cost of a second-class train ticket (to and fro) per person, whichever is less, will be provided.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste.This facility will be given one time only.﻿
The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste.
This facility will be given one time only.
Exclusions: The applicant should not be a Government Employee (including Boards/Corporations/Authorities/Government Undertakings and such Establishments).﻿﻿
The applicant should not be a Government Employee (including Boards/Corporations/Authorities/Government Undertakings and such Establishments).
Application Process: OfflineThe applicant shall contact the concerned Antodaya Bhawan for registration, along with the required documents and intimation of the expected date of journey for this purpose.Notes:The number of persons are fixed for registration, i.e. 100 per constituency. Registration will be done on a first-come, first-served basis.Reimbursement will be made after journey on the submission of railway tickets.The budget will be allotted to the District Welfare officers for this purpose.﻿
The number of persons are fixed for registration, i.e. 100 per constituency. Registration will be done on a first-come, first-served basis.
Reimbursement will be made after journey on the submission of railway tickets.
The budget will be allotted to the District Welfare officers for this purpose.
Documents Required: Copy of Scheduled Castes Certificate (along with original)Residence Proof/Ration Card/Voter CardUndertaking Regarding Non-Government Employee (including Boards/Corporations/Authorities/Government Undertakings and such Establishments)﻿
Copy of Scheduled Castes Certificate (along with original)
Undertaking Regarding Non-Government Employee (including Boards/Corporations/Authorities/Government Undertakings and such Establishments)
Frequently Asked Questions: What is the main objective of this scheme?The main objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance for the Varanasi and Amritsar yatra for Scheduled Caste persons.Who is eligible to apply for this yatra scheme?Only persons belonging to the Scheduled Caste are eligible to apply for this yatra scheme.Do I need to be a resident of Haryana to apply?Yes, the applicant should be a resident of Haryana to be eligible for this scheme.Can a government employee apply for this scheme?No, a government employee (including those in Boards, Corporations, Authorities, or Government Undertakings and such Establishments) cannot apply for this scheme.How many times can I avail this facility?This facility will be given only one time per eligible person.What documents are required for registration?You need to provide a copy of your Scheduled Castes certificate (along with the original), residence proof (like a Ration Card or Voter Card), and an undertaking stating you are not a Government employee.Do I need to inform about my journey date during registration?Yes, you need to provide an intimation of your expected date of journey for this purpose during registration.﻿Is there a limit on the number of people who can register from one constituency?Yes, a fixed number of 100 persons per constituency are allowed for registration.﻿How is the registration processed if many people apply?Registration will be done on a "First Come First Serve" basis.Which class of train ticket is covered for reimbursement?Only the cost of a second-class train ticket (to and fro) is covered for reimbursement.

additional_details.meta_description: The scheme "State Art Exhibition Competition" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote fine arts and recognize artistic talents by providing awards and scholarships to artists, art students, and school children across Gujarat.
additional_details.description: Are you sure you want to sign out? | | Enter scheme name to search... Enter scheme name to search...

Details: The scheme "State Art Exhibition Competition" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and appreciate the creative pursuits of artists, art students, and school children through state-level art exhibitions and competitions in disciplines like painting, sculpture, graphic arts, applied arts, and visual arts. Participants are invited through public advertisements in newspapers, and entries are judged by expert panels. Winners receive cash prizes, certificates, and an opportunity to exhibit their work at the Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan. Prize-winning art institute students are also eligible for a monthly scholarship. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. 2 entries each from artists and students of art institutions and a maximum of 14 entries from classes 1 to 5 and 14 entries from classes 6 to 10 from a school are invited through the school in a prescribed format.﻿
Benefits: Artists Category:23 prizes totaling ₹1,74,500/-.Art Institute Students Category:16 prizes totaling ₹48,000/-.School Children Category:50 prizes totaling ₹25,000/-.Scholarship:Winning students in the art institution category are eligible for a monthly scholarship of ₹1,000/-.﻿﻿﻿
Artists Category:23 prizes totaling ₹1,74,500/-.
Art Institute Students Category:16 prizes totaling ₹48,000/-.
School Children Category:50 prizes totaling ₹25,000/-.
Scholarship:Winning students in the art institution category are eligible for a monthly scholarship of ₹1,000/-.
Eligibility: Artists/ art institute students and school children in Gujarat are eligible under this scheme.Students should be studying in classes 1st to 10th in Gujarat.﻿
Artists/ art institute students and school children in Gujarat are eligible under this scheme.
Students should be studying in classes 1st to 10th in Gujarat.

Frequently Asked Questions: What is the main purpose of the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition”The scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” has been introduced to inspire, promote, and provide recognition to artists, students of art institutions, and school children across Gujarat by encouraging participation in fine arts and offering awards and exhibition opportunities to deserving talents.﻿﻿﻿Who is eligible to participate in the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition”?The scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” is open to three categories of participants: individual artists residing in Gujarat, students currently enrolled in recognized art institutions within the state, and school children studying in Classes 1 to 10 in schools located in Gujarat.﻿﻿﻿What kind of artworks are accepted under the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition”?The scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” accepts creative submissions in various fields of fine arts including painting, sculpture, graphic arts, applied arts, and visual arts from eligible participants, allowing a wide range of artistic expression.﻿﻿﻿How many entries can each participant or institution submit to the competition?Under the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition,” each individual artist and each student of an art institution may submit a maximum of two entries, while each school may submit up to 14 entries from students in Classes 1 to 5 and another 14 entries from Classes 6 to 10 through the school’s official process.﻿﻿﻿What is the total value of the prizes awarded through the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition”?The scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” distributes a total of 89 prizes with a combined value of ₹2,47,500, divided among artists, art institution students, and school children as a means of recognizing excellence in artistic creation.﻿﻿﻿How are the winners selected in the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition”?In the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition,” all submitted artworks are assessed and judged by panels comprising field-specific experts who select winners based on artistic merit, originality, and overall quality of the work.﻿﻿﻿What are the different prize categories under the scheme?The scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” provides 23 prizes worth ₹1,74,500 in the artist category, 16 prizes worth ₹48,000 in the art institution student category, and 50 prizes worth ₹25,000 in the school children category.﻿﻿﻿Is there any additional benefit for winning students of art institutions in the scheme?Yes, in addition to prize money, students of art institutions who win under the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” are also eligible to receive a monthly scholarship of ₹1,000 funded from the interest earned on a dedicated corpus fund.﻿﻿﻿What type of recognition do the winners of the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” receive?The winners of the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” receive cash prizes, certificates of merit, an opportunity to showcase their artworks in a dedicated exhibition, and inclusion in a catalogue featuring the prize-winning entries.﻿﻿﻿Where is the exhibition of selected artworks organized?Under the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition,” the selected and winning entries are exhibited at the art gallery located in Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan, providing public exposure and recognition to the artists.﻿﻿﻿How are participants informed about the call for entries for this scheme?The call for entries under the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” is made public through paid advertisements in daily newspapers, inviting eligible participants to submit their artworks in the prescribed format.﻿﻿﻿Are participants from outside Gujarat eligible to apply for the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition”?No, the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” is exclusively intended for participants who are residents of Gujarat, and individuals from outside the state are not eligible to apply.﻿How are the prize funds of the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” sourced?The prize funds for the scheme “State Art Exhibition Competition” are partially provided by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy and partially from the interest accrued on donations made by eminent artists and well-wishers of the fine arts community.﻿
